title: Loch Grannoch Walking Route

images.title: Richard Webb / Loch Grannoch
images.caption: The loch, now surrounded by forestry, with Cairnsmore of Fleet in the background.

images.title: Chris Newman / Loch Grannoch Monument
images.caption: Loch Grannoch Monument. Memorial to Maggie, the last packhorse to serve Loch Grannoch shooting lodge (now an outdoor centre) from Gatehouse-of-Fleet. The memorial stands on the E side of the track near a ravine, behind are the crags of Cleugh of Eglon.

images.title: Richard Webb / North end of Loch Grannoch
images.caption: North end of the loch. Fortunately there has been some clear felling here, so the loch was visible. The small island, Eagle Island has black headed gulls on it instead of eagles.

description: This attractive loch is part of the Galloway Forest Park in Dumfries and Galloway. To the east of the loch there's a shared cycling and walking route running through the adjacent forestry. You can follow this trail from the nearby Clatteringshaws Loch to reach the loch. It's a very beautiful and remote place with attractive forestry and hills surrounding the scenic lake. Look out for the black headed gulls on the island in the middle of the loch.
